newsitem.title: FRANCE: Renault plant shut due to truckers' strike.
newsitem.headline: Renault plant shut due to truckers' strike.

text.p: French carmaker Renault SA said on Monday it had halted work at its Douai plant in northern France because striking truckers are blocking the plant's supplies.
A spokeswoman for the group said the Monday afternoon shift and Tuesday morning shift at the plant, which makes the Megane, had been cancelled.
The MCA plant at Mabeuge, which makes utilitarian vehicles, has also been closed.
"We're monitoring the situation. At the moment only these two plants have been disrupted," the spokeswoman said.
At PSA Peugeot Citroen there was no immediate comment on whether the group's production was affected by strikes and blockades by French truckers whose action went into its second week on Monday.
Lengthy talks between employers and labour unions in the transport sector, chaired by a state-appointed mediator, broke down on Monday morning.
